instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1706: What is A1706? A1706 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years 2016, Mid 2017 with EMC 3071, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00239, 820-00923..
definitions.820-00239: What is 820-00239? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Screen lights up, no image on LCD.
threads.message:
Backlight works, get video to an external monitor, LCD just lights up black. No sign of liquid damage anywhere. 

Not had one of these with this problem before. Poked around schematic a bit, not sure where to start.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Screen lights up, no image on LCD.
threads.message: First thing would be to try a known good LCD and yes I know that is a bitch. Or go moan and bitch at Apple as a machine that costs $$$$ should not fail in 2 years.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Screen lights up, no image on LCD.
threads.message: Thanks Duke. Noping out of this one. Don't have an LCD to try, not going to buy one just to test.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Screen lights up, no image on LCD.
threads.message: I know this newer stuff sucks. Need to scrape together some cracked LCDs for testing and such. Seeing that the backlight works there is a good chance it is just a bad LCD. But like I said, go moan and bitch at Apple especially if you are EU based they will fix it as they should.
